page.title: 18Farm Crops in Newburgh Area
page.content: For a very long time farming has been important in the Newburgh area.Most of the land in this area is very good for farming.It has very rich soil which has provided good grazing land and crops. The most common crops grown are Corn,Wheat,Oil and Fodder Rape,Potatoes,Peas,Turnips and Silage.During the winter silage and turnips will provide fodder for the farmers to feed their animals. The farmers year starts off by ploughing his fields.In March the farmer lifts his turnips.The farmer plants his crops in April.In July the farmer also cuts the silage.In August and September the farmer harvests his crops.Then in October,November and December the farmer ploughs his fields.They use their crops for feeding,re-seeding and for sale.
